comments.body:
## Summary by CodeRabbit ## Release Notes * **New Features** * Added "Extract" malware policy option alongside existing purge and isolate modes. * Implemented path-aware filtering in Lean Mode to better exclude BIOS and firmware directories. * Directory structure now preserved when extracting archives. * New system diagnostics panel for dependency and font health checks. * **Bug Fixes** * Fixed archive extraction to always extract files before malware scanning. * **Documentation** * Added Lean Shield Deployment Guide with validation and rollback procedures. * Added Always-On Archive & Security Layer Architecture guide. * **UI Improvements** * Enhanced visual focus indicators across configuration and setup panels. * **Tests** * Added comprehensive test coverage for extraction policies, lean-mode filtering, and archive structure preservation. ## Walkthrough This PR introduces an "extract" malware policy, hardens Lean Mode with path-aware BIOS filtering and surgical non-whitelist purging, decouples archive extraction from malware detection with folder-structure preservation, refactors UI borders to be focus-driven, overhauls test infrastructure from mocks to spies, and adds deployment documentation. ## Changes |Cohort / File(s)|Summary| |---|---| |**Extract Policy Core**
`src/lib/config.ts`, `src/lib/sync/types.ts`, `src/lib/shield/types.ts`, `src/lib/shield/ShieldExecutor.ts`, `docs/tickets/Add__Extract__Policy__Support_Extraction_Without_Malware_Isolation.md`|Expands malware_policy union from "purge" \| "isolate" to include "extract" across config, types, and execution contexts; adds migration for backward compatibility and introduces three-policy UI model.| |**Archive Extraction & Cleanup Refactoring**
`src/lib/cleanup.ts`, `docs/tickets/Fix_Clean_Archive_Bypass__Extract_All_Archives_Regardless_of_Malware_Detection.md`, `docs/tickets/Fix_Folder_Flattening__Preserve_Directory_Structure_During_Extraction.md`|Decouples extraction from malware detection by always extracting KEEP_EXTS files first, preserves directory structure during extraction, introduces staging-area workflow, adds support for extract/purge/isolate policy branching, and includes recursive archive scanning and garbage-pattern refinements.| |**Lean Mode Path-Aware Filtering**
`src/lib/shield/archiveAnalyzer.ts`, `src/lib/shield/patterns.ts`, `src/lib/shield/ShieldManager.ts`, `src/lib/sync/pullPhase.ts`, `scripts/simulate-lean-shield.ts`, `docs/tickets/Fix_Path_Filtering_Bypass__Check_Full_Path_for_BIOS_Exclusions_in_Lean_Mode.md`|Refactors shouldDownloadInLeanMode to check full paths instead of filenames; adds LEAN_MODE_EXCLUDE_PATTERNS, LEAN_STRICT_WHITELIST, LEAN_STRICT_BLACKLIST, and BIOS_HARD_STOPS; introduces ShieldManager.isFilteredPath utility; adds simulation script for manifest filtering.| |**Focus-Driven Border Styling**
`src/components/SyncPortal.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/DirectoryConfig.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/MirrorSettings.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/SourceChoice.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/UpsyncConfig.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/providers/B2Setup.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/providers/DropboxSetup.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/providers/GDriveSetup.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/providers/MegaSetup.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/providers/OneDriveSetup.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/providers/PCloudSetup.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/providers/R2Setup.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/providers/S3Setup.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/providers/SFTPSetup.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/steps/DownloadModeStep.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/steps/LocalDirStep.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/steps/SecurityStep.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/steps/ShortcutStep.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/steps/SourceChoiceStep.tsx`, `src/components/wizard/steps/EditMenuStep.tsx`|Converts unconditional border props to conditional borders driven by focus/selection state (isFocused, isBackFocused, focusArea); adds alignItems="flex-start" for layout alignment; updates borderColor to use "transparent" when unfocused instead of dim colors; affects 20+ wizard and setup component files.| |**Component Refactoring & Layout**
`src/components/AboutView.tsx`, `src/components/AppContent.tsx`, `src/components/DoctorView.tsx`, `src/components/FontInstaller.tsx`, `src/components/ForensicView.tsx`, `src/components/ManualFontGuide.tsx`, `src/components/Options.tsx`|Extracts DoctorView into dedicated component with diagnostics/font-health panels; refactors AboutView layout with nested containers; adds hover-state tracking in ForensicView; makes FontInstaller borders explicit; updates Options to support extract policy and fixes type casting; minor spacing adjustments.| |**Test Infrastructure Modernization**
`src/tests/Authorize.test.ts`, `src/tests/cleanup.test.ts`, `src/tests/e2e/parallel-sync.test.ts`, `src/tests/e2e/sync-flow.test.tsx`, `src/tests/rclone.test.ts`, `src/tests/remote-manifest.test.ts`, `src/tests/updater.test.ts`|Replaces Bun mock-module approach with spyOn-based spying on exported functions; adds RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH environment setup; updates test assertions to use spy calls instead of mock stubs; improves cleanup/teardown for spy restoration; enhances test robustness.| |**New Test Suites**
`src/tests/lean-mode.test.ts`, `src/tests/lean-mode-integration.test.ts`, `src/tests/sync.test.ts`|Expands lean-mode test coverage with ShieldManager path filtering, surgical cleaning, and extraction validation; adds integration tests for lean/full mode file preservation; introduces rawBytesTransferred numeric field in progress tracking; silences logging via spies.| |**Utility & Config Updates**
`src/lib/sync/utils.ts`, `src/lib/config.ts`|Implements concurrent stdout/stderr reading in executeRcloneSimple for improved timing; adds malware_policy migration defaulting to "purge" for backward compatibility.| |**Documentation & Artifacts**
`docs/LEAN_MODE_DEPLOYMENT.md`, `docs/specs/Always-On_Archive_&_Security_Layer_Architecture.md`, `.changeset/chatty-ads-shave.md`, `boardview.tvw`|Adds Lean Shield Deployment Guide (v1.2.3) with pre/post-deployment checklists and rollback procedures; introduces Always-On Archive & Security Layer Architecture spec; records changeset for patch release; includes test artifact boardview.tvw.| ## Sequence Diagram(s) ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant Cleanup as Cleanup Engine participant Archive as Archive Handler participant Malware as Malware Scanner participant Policy as Policy Enforcer participant Stats as Statistics User->>Cleanup: runCleanupSweep(policy: extract) Cleanup->>Archive: scanStandaloneFiles() Archive-->>Cleanup: fileList (if policy != extract) Cleanup->>Archive: extractAllKeepFiles() Archive->>Archive: preserveDirectoryStructure() Archive-->>Cleanup: extractedPaths[] Cleanup->>Malware: scanExtractedFiles() Malware-->>Cleanup: flaggedFiles[] Cleanup->>Policy: applyPolicy(flaggedFiles, policy) alt policy = "extract" Policy->>Archive: deleteArchiveAfterExtract() Policy->>Stats: incrementExtractedCount() else policy = "purge" Policy->>Archive: purgeAllArchive() else policy = "isolate" Policy->>Archive: moveToQuarantine() end Policy-->>Cleanup: policyApplied Cleanup->>Stats: updateStats(extractedCount, policyMode) Stats-->>User: CleanupStats(policyMode: extract) ``` ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Download as Download Gate participant Scanner as Path Scanner participant Patterns as Pattern Engine participant Shield as Lean Shield participant FileList as File Disposition Download->>Scanner: shouldDownloadInLeanMode(fullPath) Scanner->>Patterns: checkLEAN_MODE_EXCLUDE_PATTERNS() alt Path matches BIOS/Firmware/Drivers Patterns-->>Scanner: excluded=true Scanner-->>Download: false (block) else Path does not match Patterns-->>Scanner: excluded=false Scanner->>Shield: deferToShieldLayer() Shield->>Shield: applyWHITELIST/BLACKLIST Shield-->>FileList: keep/strip/isolate end Download-->>FileList: finalDisposition ``` ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 4 (Complex) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~75 minutes ## Poem > üê∞ *From archives deep we extract with care,* > *Preserving folders floating in the air,* > *BIOS paths we surgically prune,* > *While extract mode hums a policy tune,* > *Borders that focus, tests that inspire‚Äî* > *Lean Shield soars ever higher!* ‚ú®
üö• Pre-merge checks | ‚úÖ 2 | ‚ùå 1
‚ùå Failed checks (1 warning) | Check name | Status | Explanation | Resolution | | :----------------: | :--------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | :--------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Docstring Coverage | ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning | Docstring coverage is 33.33% which is insufficient. The required threshold is 80.00%. | Write docstrings for the functions missing them to satisfy the coverage threshold. |
‚úÖ Passed checks (2 passed) | Check name | Status | Explanation | | :---------------: | :------- | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Title check | ‚úÖ Passed | The PR title clearly summarizes the main changes: hardening lean mode logic and enforcing extract policy as part of v1.2.3 remediation. | | Description check | ‚úÖ Passed | The PR description is directly related to the changeset, detailing strict lean purging, path-aware filtering, extract policy enforcement, component refactoring, and UI fixes with test verification. |
‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can configure your own custom pre-merge checks in the settings.
‚ú® Finishing touches - [ ] üìù Generate docstrings
üß™ Generate unit tests (beta) - [ ] Create PR with unit tests - [ ] Post copyable unit tests in a comment - [ ] Commit unit tests in branch `feature/lean-shield-hardening-rem-7-7.5-v1.2.3`
--- Thanks for using [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai?utm_source=oss&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=RepairYourTech/schem-sync-portal&utm_content=26)! It's free for OSS, and your support helps us grow. If you like it, consider giving us a shout-out.
‚ù§Ô∏è Share - [X](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A&url=https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [Mastodon](https://mastodon.social/share?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai) - [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/submit?title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&text=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai&mini=true&title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&summary=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code)

reviews.body:
**Actionable comments posted: 16** > [!CAUTION] > Some comments are outside the diff and can‚Äôt be posted inline due to platform limitations. > > > >
> ‚ö†Ô∏è Outside diff range comments (5)
> >
> src/components/wizard/providers/PCloudSetup.tsx (1)
> > `123-151`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_ > > **Guides section borders were not updated ‚Äî inconsistent with S3Setup, GDriveSetup, and SFTPSetup.** > > The DONE button (line 127) and Back button (line 146) in the guides section still use unconditional `border` props, while the equivalent sections in S3Setup.tsx, GDriveSetup.tsx, and SFTPSetup.tsx were updated to use conditional `border={focusArea === "body"}` and `border={selectedIndex === 1 && focusArea === "body"}` respectively. The `borderColor` on line 129 also still uses `colors.dim` for the unfocused state instead of `"transparent"`. > > >
> Proposed fix to align with other providers > > ```diff > marginTop={1} > onMouseOver={() => onFocusChange("body")} > onMouseDown={() => next()} > - border > + border={focusArea === "body"} > borderStyle="double" > - borderColor={focusArea === "body" ? colors.success : colors.dim} > + borderColor={focusArea === "body" ? colors.success : "transparent"} > paddingLeft={1} > paddingRight={1} > > > ``` > > ```diff > marginTop={1} > onMouseOver={() => { > onFocusChange("body"); > setSelectedIndex(1); > }} > onMouseDown={() => back()} > paddingLeft={1} > paddingRight={1} > - border > + border={selectedIndex === 1 && focusArea === "body"} > borderStyle="single" > borderColor={selectedIndex === 1 && focusArea === "body" ? colors.success : "transparent"} > > > ``` >
> >
>
> src/components/wizard/steps/SecurityStep.tsx (1)
> > `44-69`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üî¥ Critical_ > > **Fix index mismatch: pass option object directly to `confirmSelection` instead of using `allOptions[i]`.** > > Line 54 uses `confirmSelection(allOptions[i]!)`, mapping indices from the local `filteredOptions` array against `allOptions` from the wizard context. These are different arrays with different contents. When `config.backup_provider === "gdrive"`, `filteredOptions` contains only 2 items (indices 0-1), but `allOptions[0]` and `allOptions[1]` are wizard navigation options, not security options. > > Pass the option object directly instead, matching the correct pattern used in other wizard steps: > > ```javascript > onMouseDown={() => confirmSelection(opt)} > ``` > > instead of: > > ```javascript > onMouseDown={() => confirmSelection(allOptions[i]!)} > ``` > >
>
> src/tests/remote-manifest.test.ts (1)
> > `26-31`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_ > > **`RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH` is not cleaned up in `afterAll`.** > > `MOCK_RCLONE` is deleted but `RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH` (set on Line 23) is not, which could leak into subsequent test suites. > >
> Proposed fix > > ```diff > afterAll(() => { > delete process.env.MOCK_RCLONE; > + delete process.env.RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH; > if (existsSync(testDir)) { > rmSync(testDir, { recursive: true, force: true }); > } > }); > ``` >
> >
>
> src/tests/Authorize.test.ts (1)
> > `33-42`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_ > > **`RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH` set in `beforeEach` but never cleaned up.** > > Similar to the issue in `remote-manifest.test.ts`, the environment variable persists after tests complete. > >
> Proposed fix > > ```diff > afterAll(() => { > mockSpawn.mockRestore(); > mockSpawnSync.mockRestore(); > mockExistsSync.mockRestore(); > + delete process.env.RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH; > }); > ``` >
> >
>
> src/components/Options.tsx (1)
> > `67-91`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ > > **Filter "extract" policy in Options.tsx when Google Drive is the backup provider.** > > Lines 71‚Äì84 prevent disabling shield for Google Drive, but still allow cycling through the full options array including "extract". The Wizard correctly filters out "extract" for gdrive users (SecurityStep.tsx:28), but the Options panel does not. A gdrive user can reach the Options menu and cycle the shield policy to "extract," overriding the intent documented in config.ts line 132: "Allow user to choose between 'isolate' and 'purge' policies." > > When extract policy is active, all malware detection is bypassed. Combined with Google Drive's requirement for mandatory shield protection to prevent account suspension, this creates an inconsistency where users can circumvent a critical safety constraint via the Options UI that the Wizard explicitly prevents. > > Apply the same filter from SecurityStep.tsx: > ```typescript > const options = [false, "purge", "isolate", "extract"]; > const filteredOptions = config.backup_provider === "gdrive" > ? options.filter(o => o.value !== false && o.value !== "extract") > : options; > // Use filteredOptions instead of options for cycling > ``` > >
> >
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In `@docs/LEAN_MODE_DEPLOYMENT.md`: - Around line 20-27: The Success Metrics table is inconsistent: update "Valuable Files Kept" and "Storage Reduction" so thresholds and reported values use the same semantics; specifically either change the "Valuable Files Kept" threshold to match the simulated value (e.g., ">=84.5%") or update the simulated value to exceed ">85%", and for "Storage Reduction" either change the threshold units to file-count reduction (e.g., ">15% (files)") or convert the current "~15% (files)" into a bytes-based percentage to match ">50% (bytes)"; make these edits in the "Success Metrics" section, touching the rows for "Valuable Files Kept" and "Storage Reduction" so thresholds and Current (Sim) columns meaningfully align. In `@docs/tickets/Fix_Path_Filtering_Bypass__Check_Full_Path_for_BIOS_Exclusions_in_Lean_Mode.md`: - Around line 96-108: The test expectation is inconsistent with the current implementation in archiveAnalyzer.ts: the function shouldDownloadInLeanMode currently only checks path exclusions and will exclude any path containing "bios", so update the ticket/tests to expect false for shouldDownloadInLeanMode("BIOS/boardview.zip") OR implement the missing valuable-indicator bypass in shouldDownloadInLeanMode by checking filename indicators (e.g., "boardview", "schematics", other configured valuable patterns) before applying the BIOS path exclusion so those filenames return true; locate and modify the shouldDownloadInLeanMode function in archiveAnalyzer.ts to either change the test assertion or add the early valuable-indicator override and corresponding unit tests. In `@scripts/simulate-lean-shield.ts`: - Around line 6-12: The isExcludedAtPathGate function currently lowercases and normalizes relPath and patterns but always uses plain includes; update it to mirror archiveAnalyzer.ts's shouldDownloadInLeanMode behavior by treating patterns that start with "/" as anchored to the path root: create a normalizedPathWithRoot = "/" + normalizedRelPath (or ensure a leading "/") and when a pattern's normalized form startsWith "/" match against normalizedPathWithRoot, otherwise match against the normalizedRelPath as currently done; adjust variable names in isExcludedAtPathGate (e.g., lower, lowerP) accordingly so patterns beginning with "/" are matched the same way as in shouldDownloadInLeanMode. - Around line 61-62: The reduction calculation can divide by zero when lines.length is 0; in simulate-lean-shield.ts check lines.length before computing reduction (the variables involved are totalKept, shieldKeptGoods, shieldKeptAmbiguous, reduction and lines.length) and handle the empty-manifest case (e.g., set reduction to 0 or skip the calculation/reporting) so you never perform ((lines.length - totalKept) / lines.length) when lines.length === 0. - Around line 14-15: The script currently hardcodes manifestPath which prevents reuse; change the manifestPath assignment to read from a CLI argument (e.g., process.argv[2]) with a sensible fallback or explicit error if absent, validate the path before calling readFileSync, and preserve the existing lines = readFileSync(...).split(...).filter(...) logic; update any references to manifestPath and add a brief usage message when missing to guide developers (use symbols: manifestPath, process.argv, readFileSync, lines). In `@src/lib/cleanup.ts`: - Around line 231-298: Nested archive scanning is currently ineffective because files are moved from stagingDir to dirPath (via renameSync) before scanForNestedArchives runs; to fix, invoke scanForNestedArchives when the nested archives still reside in stagingDir (call await scanForNestedArchives(stagingDir, baseDir, policy, stats, onProgress, mode) immediately after extraction of each pattern or once after all patterns but before any renameSync moves), or alternatively track moved archive paths and call scanForNestedArchives on those destinations (scan dirPath only for the specific rel paths moved) ‚Äî update the extraction loop around renameSync, cleanFile, and the final scanForNestedArchives call accordingly so nested archives are discovered and recursively processed. In `@src/lib/shield/patterns.ts`: - Around line 80-96: LEAN_MODE_EXCLUDE_PATTERNS contains overly short entries "ec/", "ec\\", "fw/", "fw\\" that cause false positives when using .includes() on lowered paths; update the array (referencing LEAN_MODE_EXCLUDE_PATTERNS) to remove the bare "ec"/"fw" variants or replace them with versions that require a path separator prefix (e.g., keep only "/ec/", "\\ec\\", "/fw/", "\\fw\\") so the matcher only excludes true path-scoped folders. - Around line 74-78: The exported constant BIOS_HARD_STOPS is dead code and its comment is misleading; remove the entire BIOS_HARD_STOPS declaration and its export from patterns.ts (and any nearby misleading comment about "Only match as folder if at root") so there is no unused symbol exported, or if you intended to keep this behavior instead update the matching logic that consumes it (e.g., use startsWith/regex rather than .includes) and correct the comment‚Äîlocate the BIOS_HARD_STOPS constant in patterns.ts to apply the removal or the alternative fix. In `@src/lib/shield/ShieldManager.ts`: - Around line 222-235: The test expectation is wrong: isFilteredPath(relPath: string) with LEAN_MODE_EXCLUDE_PATTERNS is intended to use strict boundary patterns, so calling isFilteredPath("bios_update.zip") should return false; update the failing assertion in cleanup.test.ts to expect false (locate the assertion referencing "bios_update.zip" around the test at line ~191) to match the implementation of isFilteredPath and the patterns in LEAN_MODE_EXCLUDE_PATTERNS. In `@src/tests/cleanup.test.ts`: - Around line 187-192: The test expectation is wrong: ShieldManager.isFilteredPath("bios_update.zip") returns false because LEAN_MODE_EXCLUDE_PATTERNS only match directory-scoped tokens (e.g., "bios/") or exact filenames; update the test in cleanup.test.ts to expect false for ShieldManager.isFilteredPath("bios_update.zip") (or alternatively add a new test that uses a path containing a bios/ directory to assert true), referencing ShieldManager.isFilteredPath and the LEAN_MODE_EXCLUDE_PATTERNS behavior when making the change. In `@src/tests/e2e/parallel-sync.test.ts`: - Around line 17-18: The test sets process.env.RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH and creates a temp file with existsSync/writeFileSync but does not remove the env var after the test; add cleanup in the test's afterEach block to delete process.env.RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH (i.e., call delete process.env.RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH) so the environment variable does not leak between tests and mirrors the file cleanup already present. In `@src/tests/e2e/sync-flow.test.tsx`: - Around line 19-21: The test sets process.env.RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH and creates a temp file but fails to clear the env var in afterEach; update the test cleanup (the afterEach block) to remove the environment variable by calling delete process.env.RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH (or setting it to undefined) alongside the existing file removal so the RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH env doesn't point to a removed file for subsequent tests. In `@src/tests/lean-mode.test.ts`: - Around line 131-174: The test currently calls runCleanupSweep before creating the standalone bin, which can lead to flakiness if 7z/rar are available; adjust the test so all files (zipPath, binPath, standaloneBin) are created before the first call to runCleanupSweep or alternatively stub/mocks the archive engine used by runCleanupSweep to prevent real extraction; update references to archiveDir, standaloneBin and stats accordingly so the first sweep cannot mutate the directory contents before assertions run. - Around line 6-18: The logger spies (infoSpy, debugSpy, warnSpy, errorSpy) are created at module scope but restored inside the first describe("Lean Mode Logic")'s afterAll, causing later describe blocks to run with real loggers; fix by moving the mockRestore calls out of that describe and into module-scope teardown (e.g., a top-level afterAll) or wrap all tests in a single outer describe so a single afterAll restores all spies ‚Äî update references to infoSpy, debugSpy, warnSpy, and errorSpy accordingly and ensure the outer describe is closed at the end of the file if you choose that approach. In `@src/tests/sync.test.ts`: - Line 28: The test sets process.env.RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH but doesn't remove it in afterAll, leaking env state; update the afterAll cleanup (the same block that deletes process.env.MOCK_RCLONE and process.env.MOCK_LATENCY) to also delete process.env.RCLONE_CONFIG_PATH and delete process.env.PORTAL_CONFIG_PATH so both config paths are cleared after tests complete. In `@src/tests/updater.test.ts`: - Around line 7-15: The mocked Bun.spawnSync return objects in the test do not include stderr and exitCode fields, so update every returned object in the mock (the branches that match "git --version", "git remote get-url origin", "git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD", "git fetch", "git pull", "git stash pop", "git stash" and the final fallback) to include stderr: Buffer.from("") and exitCode: 0 alongside success and stdout to accurately match the real Bun.spawnSync shape; ensure you add these two properties to each return expression in the mock block in updater.test.ts. ```
üßπ Nitpick comments (23)
src/tests/sync.test.ts (1)
`68-69`: **Stale comment ‚Äî references the old `bytesTransferred` string field.** The comment mentions format variants (MiB, MB, bytes) which no longer apply to the numeric `rawBytesTransferred` field.
Suggested update ```diff - // Flexible check for bytesTransferred (might be MiB, MB, or just bytes depending on mock) - expect(midPull.rawBytesTransferred).toBeGreaterThan(0); + // Verify raw byte count is populated + expect(midPull.rawBytesTransferred).toBeGreaterThan(0); ```
src/tests/updater.test.ts (2)
`7-13`: **Order-dependent `includes` matching is fragile.** `cmd.includes("git stash")` (line 13) also matches `"git stash pop"`. It works today only because line 12 is checked first. If someone reorders these branches or adds a new `git stash list` case, the wrong stub will silently fire. Consider using `startsWith` or exact equality on the joined command, or at minimum add a comment warning about ordering.
‚ôªÔ∏è Suggested safer matching ```diff - if (cmd.includes("git stash pop")) return { success: true, stdout: Buffer.from("") } as any; - if (cmd.includes("git stash")) return { success: true, stdout: Buffer.from("Saved working directory") } as any; + // Order matters: check more-specific commands first + if (cmd === "git stash pop") return { success: true, stdout: Buffer.from("") } as any; + if (cmd === "git stash") return { success: true, stdout: Buffer.from("Saved working directory") } as any; ```
--- `29-32`: **Empty test body silently passes, giving false confidence.** This test will always pass, inflating the green count. Either mark it with `test.todo` (Bun supports this) or `test.skip` so it's visibly incomplete in the test report.
‚ôªÔ∏è Suggested fix ```diff - test("should handle missing git gracefully", async () => { - // We need a way to change the mock behavior mid-test. - // For now, these tests are basic. In a real scenario, we'd use a more robust mocking strategy. - }); + test.todo("should handle missing git gracefully"); ```
src/components/ManualFontGuide.tsx (1)
`97-106`: **Dead `borderStyle` and `borderColor` props on the Esc button.** With `border={false}`, the `borderStyle="single"` and `borderColor={colors.danger}` on Lines 100-101 have no effect. Consider removing them to avoid confusion.
‚ôªÔ∏è Suggested cleanup ```diff ```
src/components/FontInstaller.tsx (2)
`165-174`: **`border={false}` makes `borderStyle` and `borderColor` dead props.** When `border` is `false`, the border isn't rendered, so `borderStyle="single"` and `borderColor={colors.danger}` have no effect. If the intent is to hide the border on Cancel buttons, remove the redundant props. If the border should be visible, change to `border={true}`.
Proposed fix (assuming border should be hidden) ```diff onCancel()} border={false} - borderStyle="single" - borderColor={colors.danger} paddingLeft={1} paddingRight={1} > ```
--- `227-236`: **Same dead-prop issue on the error-state Cancel button.** Same as above ‚Äî `borderStyle` and `borderColor` are specified alongside `border={false}`.
src/components/wizard/steps/ShortcutStep.tsx (2)
`34-55`: **Extract repeated focus condition into a local variable.** The expression `selectedIndex === i && focusArea === "body"` is evaluated four times per iteration (lines 44, 46, 51, 53). Other wizard components in this PR (e.g., `MirrorSettings`, `UpsyncConfig`) extract this into `const isFocused = ‚Ä¶` for clarity and consistency.
Proposed refactor ```diff {options.map((opt, i) => ( - - - {String(opt.description)} - + - {String(opt.description)} + ); ))} ```
--- `57-72`: **Same repeated expression for the Back button.** `selectedIndex === options.length && focusArea === "body"` is repeated three times (lines 63, 65, 70). Extract to a local `isBackFocused` variable, consistent with the pattern in `MirrorSettings` and `UpsyncConfig`.
src/components/wizard/providers/MegaSetup.tsx (1)
`125-154`: **Guide section still uses unconditional borders ‚Äî inconsistent with the intro section above.** The intro section (lines 58, 83) was updated to use conditional `border={isFocused}` / `border={isBackFocused}`, but the guide section's "DONE" button (line 129) and "Back" button (line 149) still use unconditional `border`. This leaves an inconsistent visual behavior within the same component.
Proposed fix ```diff onFocusChange("body")} onMouseDown={() => next()} - border + border={focusArea === "body"} borderStyle="double" borderColor={focusArea === "body" ? colors.success : "transparent"} ``` ```diff back()} paddingLeft={1} paddingRight={1} - border + border={selectedIndex === 1 && focusArea === "body"} borderStyle="single" borderColor={selectedIndex === 1 && focusArea === "body" ? colors.success : "transparent"} ```
docs/specs/Always-On_Archive_&_Security_Layer_Architecture.md (1)
`198-209`: **Misleading counter name in extract policy pseudocode.** The spec increments `stats.purgedFiles++` when the extract policy deletes only the archive container. Since "purgedFiles" implies malware removal, this could confuse implementers. Consider using a distinct counter (e.g., `stats.archivesRemoved`) or noting that the counter semantics should be revisited during implementation.
docs/LEAN_MODE_DEPLOYMENT.md (1)
`40-42`: **Contact names should ideally link to actual handles or be more formal.** "Birdman" and "Antigravity AI" as critical contacts without email, Slack handle, or on-call reference aren't actionable during an incident.

src/components/DoctorView.tsx (1)
`58-157`: **Consider extracting the IIFE into a named helper for readability.** The immediately-invoked function expression that builds font management buttons (lines 58-157) spans ~100 lines. While it works correctly and was lifted as-is from `AppContent`, extracting it into a small helper component or function (e.g., `FontManagementActions`) would reduce the cognitive load of the render body. src/tests/lean-mode-integration.test.ts (1)
`9-9`: **`Date.now()` may collide in parallel test runs.** If this test file is executed concurrently with itself (e.g., via `--rerun-each`), `Date.now()` could produce the same value. Consider appending a random suffix like the E2E tests do (`Math.random().toString(36).slice(2)`).
‚ôªÔ∏è Suggested fix ```diff - const testDir = join(tmpdir(), "lean-integration-" + Date.now()); + const testDir = join(tmpdir(), "lean-integration-" + Date.now() + "-" + Math.random().toString(36).slice(2)); ```
src/components/Options.tsx (1)
`75-78`: **Consider narrowing the type cast instead of using `any`.** The `eslint-disable` + `as any` on the `indexOf` call works but obscures type safety. Since the local `options` array includes `false` alongside the three malware policy values, you can derive a concrete type and avoid the `any` cast:
‚ôªÔ∏è Suggested refactoring ```diff - const options: (false | "purge" | "isolate" | "extract")[] = [false, "purge", "isolate", "extract"]; const current = config.enable_malware_shield ? config.malware_policy : false; - // eslint-disable-next-line `@typescript-eslint/no-explicit-any` - const nextIdx = (options.indexOf(current as any) + 1) % options.length; + const options = [false, "purge", "isolate", "extract"] as const; + type PolicyOption = (typeof options)[number]; + const nextIdx = (options.indexOf(current as PolicyOption) + 1) % options.length; ```
src/components/ForensicView.tsx (1)
`24-35`: **Hover state management looks good; consider adding `onMouseLeave` for polish.** The reset-on-state-change effect is a reasonable approach. However, there's no `onMouseLeave` handler on the button boxes, so once a user hovers a button and then moves the mouse away (without hovering another button), the highlight persists until the next state transition. This is minor for a TUI but worth noting.
src/tests/lean-mode.test.ts (1)
`19-47`: **Assertions are correct but test names are misleading after the refactor.** `shouldDownloadInLeanMode` no longer checks file extensions ‚Äî it only checks path patterns. So "Allows boardview files" (line 19) and "Allows schematic files" (line 25) pass because *everything* without an excluded path passes, not because the function recognizes boardview/schematic extensions. The test names imply extension-awareness that no longer exists.
src/lib/shield/archiveAnalyzer.ts (1)
`63-65`: **Remove unused `_archiveListing` parameter from the public API.** The parameter is never referenced in the function body and no callers pass it (all 12 call sites across tests and production code pass only the `relPath` argument). Removing it would clean up the API surface.

src/tests/cleanup.test.ts (2)
`13-24`: **Double-cast access to test-only exports is fragile but acceptable for test scaffolding.** The `as unknown as { ... }` casts on lines 23‚Äì24 bypass type safety. If the actual export signatures in `cleanup.ts` change (e.g., `__setSpawnSync` type), these casts will silently break at runtime while compiling fine. --- `38-47`: **Mock listing branch for `" *"` pattern inadvertently matches all `*.ext` glob commands.** On line 58, `cmd.includes(" *")` matches any glob pattern like `*.pdf` (because the joined command contains `" *.pdf"`), causing `boardview.tvw` to be written even when only PDFs are being extracted. Similarly, line 61's `cmd.includes(" *")` writes `schematic.pdf` during boardview extraction. This doesn't break the current tests (assertions use `toBeGreaterThanOrEqual`), but it inflates extraction counts and reduces mock fidelity. If future tests need precise counts, this will cause false passes.
Possible fix: match exact full-wildcard pattern ```diff - if (cmd.includes(" *") || cmd.includes(" boardview") || cmd.includes(".tvw")) { + if (cmd.includes(" * ") || cmd.endsWith(" *") || cmd.includes(" boardview") || cmd.includes(".tvw")) { ``` Or match `" *"` only when it's a standalone glob, not a prefix of `*.pdf`.
src/lib/cleanup.ts (2)
`88-98`: **Lean mode filtering in the no-engine branch is a no-op ‚Äî both paths push to `unscannedArchives`.** When no archive engine is available, lines 93 and 96 both push to `unscannedArchives`. The lean-mode check on line 92 adds a `continue` that skips line 96, but the outcome is identical. Consider removing the branch to reduce dead code:
Simplification ```diff - // If no engine, all archives are unscanned (but respect lean mode filtering) - for (const a of archives) { - const relPath = relative(targetDir, a).replace(/\\/g, "/"); - if (mode === "lean" && ShieldManager.isFilteredPath(relPath)) { - unscannedArchives.push(relPath); - continue; - } - unscannedArchives.push(relPath); - } + for (const a of archives) { + unscannedArchives.push(relative(targetDir, a).replace(/\\/g, "/")); + } ```
--- `374-402`: **Redundant whitelist check in lean mode ‚Äî line 397 is always `false` here.** Line 383 already returns `false` when the extension is in `LEAN_STRICT_WHITELIST`, so execution only reaches line 396 when the extension is *not* whitelisted. The `isWhitelisted` check on line 397 is always `false`, and `isGarbage` is unconditionally set to `true`. This is functionally correct (matches the stated goal of aggressively stripping non-whitelisted files), but the redundant guard is misleading to future readers.
Simplification ```diff // LEAN MODE: Strict non-whitelist purging if (mode === "lean") { - const isWhitelisted = LEAN_STRICT_WHITELIST.includes(ext.toLowerCase()); - if (!isWhitelisted) { - isGarbage = true; - Logger.info("SHIELD", `Lean Mode: Marking non-whitelisted file as garbage: ${relPath}`); - } + isGarbage = true; + Logger.info("SHIELD", `Lean Mode: Marking non-whitelisted file as garbage: ${relPath}`); } ```
